title: Amazon.com is sued over alleged sale of contaminated rice By Reuters
summary: Amazon.com is facing a lawsuit alleging the sale of rice products contaminated with arsenic and other heavy metals, including brands like Ben’s Original and Whole Foods’ 365. The lawsuit claims Amazon failed to warn consumers and seeks at least $5 million in damages, citing potential health risks.

title: Oracle to buy $40 billion of Nvidia chips for OpenAI’s US data center, FT reports By Reuters
summary: Oracle plans to spend $40 billion on Nvidia's high-performance chips to power OpenAI's new U.S. data center, part of the Stargate Project, aiming to strengthen U.S. AI competitiveness. The deal highlights Nvidia's dominance in AI chips and Oracle's push to expand its cloud computing capabilities, potentially increasing competition for Amazon Web Services (AWS).

title: Amazon not seeing notable impact from tariffs yet, Q2 revenue tracking higher By Investing.com
summary: The article states that Amazon (AMZN) has not seen a notable impact from tariffs yet and is tracking higher Q2 revenue.

summary: The article is a standard risk disclosure notice from Investing.com and does not provide any specific analyst rating updates or new information about Amazon (AMZN). It primarily outlines general risks associated with trading financial instruments and cryptocurrencies.

title: Wall St falls as Trump tariff threats spark market uncertainty By Reuters
summary: U.S. stocks, including Amazon (AMZN), declined due to renewed trade tensions after President Trump proposed 50% tariffs on European goods, sparking market uncertainty. Tech and consumer discretionary sectors were among the hardest hit, with AMZN falling over 1%.

summary: The article is a standard risk disclosure notice from Investing.com regarding trading in financial instruments and cryptocurrencies, with no specific content related to Workday Inc or its analyst rating update.

title: This CEO ’is making all the right moves to unlock meaningful upside’ By Investing.com
summary: The article highlights the CEO of AMZN, stating that they are making strategic moves to unlock significant upside potential for the company.

title: Celebrities unite at exclusive Cannes gala to support AIDS research after Trump cuts By Reuters
summary: The article covers a high-profile amfAR charity dinner at Cannes, attended by celebrities who expressed concerns about U.S. funding cuts for AIDS research. Amazon founder Jeff Bezos' fiancée, Lauren Sanchez, was among the attendees, but the event had no direct link to Amazon's business.

title: Disney seeks to stop YouTube from hiring veteran to oversee sports and media By Reuters
summary: Disney is suing YouTube (Alphabet) to block the hiring of veteran executive Justin Connolly, alleging breach of contract and unfair competition, as Connolly was under a Disney employment agreement until 2027. YouTube's aggressive push into live sports, competing with Amazon, is highlighted as part of the broader streaming wars.

title: Ackman’s hedge fund Pershing Square bets on Amazon, exits Canadian Pacific By Reuters
summary: Billionaire investor Bill Ackman's hedge fund, Pershing Square Capital Management, bought Amazon shares in April, citing confidence in the company's earnings growth, resilience to tariffs, and leadership under CEO Andrew Jassy. The fund also exited positions in Canadian Pacific and other stocks to allocate more capital to Amazon.

title: U.S. stocks mixed at close of trade; Dow Jones Industrial Average down 0.00% By Investing.com
summary: U.S. stocks closed mixed, with Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ:AMZN) among the top performers on the Dow Jones Industrial Average, gaining 0.99% to $203.12. The broader market saw sector divergences, but AMZN's upward movement stood out.

title: Amazon stock rises following Pershing Square’s stake reveal By Investing.com
summary: Amazon's stock rose 1.5% after Pershing Square disclosed a new investment in the company, citing confidence in Amazon's dual business model, AWS growth potential, and an attractive valuation. The firm views recent concerns about AWS slowdown and tariffs as temporary, projecting strong future earnings growth.

title: Amazon tests AI audio summaries for products, expanding tech giant’s AI push (May 21) By Reuters
summary: Amazon is testing AI-powered audio summaries for products, leveraging AI to analyze reviews and details, with plans to expand the feature. This follows Amazon's broader AI push, including upgrades to Alexa+ and tools like Rufus, aligning with industry trends led by OpenAI's ChatGPT.

title: Startup Anthropic says its new AI model can code for hours at a time By Reuters
summary: Anthropic, backed by Amazon, unveiled its advanced AI models Claude Opus 4 and Claude Sonnet 4, highlighting their enhanced coding autonomy and extended operational capacity. The models mark a milestone in AI development, with capabilities like prolonged coding sessions and improved reasoning, positioning Anthropic competitively in the AI space.

title: Google faces DOJ probe over Character.AI deal, Bloomberg Law reports By Reuters
summary: The U.S. Justice Department is investigating Alphabet's Google for potential antitrust violations related to its agreement with AI startup Character.AI, specifically whether the deal was structured to avoid merger scrutiny. The probe adds to regulatory pressures on Google, which is already facing antitrust cases in search and digital advertising.

title: US climate pullback threatens planned debt-for-nature deals By Reuters
summary: The article discusses how potential U.S. climate policy shifts under the Trump administration could jeopardize billions in "debt-for-nature" deals, particularly those involving ecosystems like the Amazon rainforest. Key financial backing from the U.S. International Development Finance Corporation (DFC) may dry up, leaving several countries scrambling to rework or abandon conservation-linked debt swaps.

title: Wall Street stocks end mostly flat in choppy trade as Treasury yields ease By Reuters
summary: U.S. stocks ended mostly flat in choppy trading as Treasury yields eased following the House's passage of Trump's tax and spending bill, which raised concerns about the U.S. deficit. While megacap growth stocks like Amazon gained, broader market sentiment remained cautious due to lingering uncertainties over tariffs and interest rates.

title: Stock market today: S&P 500 ends flat as US debt concerns weigh on sentiment By Investing.com
summary: The S&P 500 ended flat amid concerns over U.S. debt levels, with tech stocks like Alphabet and Snowflake partially offsetting broader market fragility. The article also highlights the House passing a contentious tax bill and mixed economic data, including stable jobless claims and slowing PMI figures. Nike's plan to sell on Amazon after six years is briefly mentioned.
